  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <span class="line"><!---->This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition"><!---->http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<!----></a><br>CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<span class="line"><!---->CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder& builder,<span class="line"><!---->    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder&amp; builder,<!----></span><br>    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<span class="line"><!---->    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br><br>  // 16: when-defined promise processing<span class="line"><!---->  // 16: when-defined promise processing<!----></span><br>  const auto& entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto&amp; entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<!----></span><br>  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<!----></span><br>    entry->value->Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<span class="line"><!---->    entry-&gt;value-&gt;Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<!----></span><br>    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<span class="line"><!---->    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<span class="line"><!---->During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<!----></span><br><br>We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<span class="line"><!---->We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined"><!---->https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<span class="line"><!---->  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise();<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise();<!----></span><br>  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<span class="line"><!---->  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<!----></span><br>  if (definition)<span class="line"><!---->  if (definition)<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<!----></span><br>  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<!----></span><br>  if (resolver)<span class="line"><!---->  if (resolver)<!----></span><br>    return resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->    return resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>  auto* new_resolver =<span class="line"><!---->  auto* new_resolver =<!----></span><br>      MakeGarbageCollected<ScriptPromiseResolver>(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->      MakeGarbageCollected&lt;ScriptPromiseResolver&gt;(script_state);<!----></span><br>  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<span class="line"><!---->  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<!----></span><br>  return new_resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->  return new_resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<span class="line"><!---->This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<!----></span><br><br>This bug is similar to this issue <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to this issue <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

          display: block;

          cursor: pointer;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <span class="line"><!---->This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition"><!---->http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<!----></a><br>CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<span class="line"><!---->CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder& builder,<span class="line"><!---->    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder&amp; builder,<!----></span><br>    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<span class="line"><!---->    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br><br>  // 16: when-defined promise processing<span class="line"><!---->  // 16: when-defined promise processing<!----></span><br>  const auto& entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto&amp; entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<!----></span><br>  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<!----></span><br>    entry->value->Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<span class="line"><!---->    entry-&gt;value-&gt;Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<!----></span><br>    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<span class="line"><!---->    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<span class="line"><!---->During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<!----></span><br><br>We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<span class="line"><!---->We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined"><!---->https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<span class="line"><!---->  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise();<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise();<!----></span><br>  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<span class="line"><!---->  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<!----></span><br>  if (definition)<span class="line"><!---->  if (definition)<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<!----></span><br>  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<!----></span><br>  if (resolver)<span class="line"><!---->  if (resolver)<!----></span><br>    return resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->    return resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>  auto* new_resolver =<span class="line"><!---->  auto* new_resolver =<!----></span><br>      MakeGarbageCollected<ScriptPromiseResolver>(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->      MakeGarbageCollected&lt;ScriptPromiseResolver&gt;(script_state);<!----></span><br>  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<span class="line"><!---->  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<!----></span><br>  return new_resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->  return new_resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<span class="line"><!---->This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<!----></span><br><br>This bug is similar to this issue <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to this issue <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        So I definitely need some repro code here. I tried with something like the below, but I'm unable to trigger a UAF in ASAN.<span class="line"><!---->So I definitely need some repro code here. I tried with something like the below, but I'm unable to trigger a UAF in ASAN.<!----></span><br><br>The iterator erase already does a re-find (see [1]) which I think should make it safe.<span class="line"><!---->The iterator erase already does a re-find (see [1]) which I think should make it safe.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4<!----></a><br><br><br>My attempted cartoon repro:<span class="line"><!---->My attempted cartoon repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>// Set up whenDefined handler that adds more whenDefined handlers:<span class="line"><!---->// Set up whenDefined handler that adds more whenDefined handlers:<!----></span><br>customElements.whenDefined('x-foo').then(() => {<span class="line"><!---->customElements.whenDefined('x-foo').then(() =&gt; {<!----></span><br>  for(let i=0;i<1e5;++i) {<span class="line"><!---->  for(let i=0;i&lt;1e5;++i) {<!----></span><br>    customElements.whenDefined('x-foo-' + i).then(() => {console.log(`foo-${i} defined`);});<span class="line"><!---->    customElements.whenDefined('x-foo-' + i).then(() =&gt; {console.log(`foo-${i} defined`);});<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br>// Define the element:<span class="line"><!---->// Define the element:<!----></span><br>customElements.define('x-foo', class extends HTMLElement {});<span class="line"><!---->customElements.define('x-foo', class extends HTMLElement {});<!----></span><br><br>// Attempt to use the whenDefined promises map by defining all of the elements:<span class="line"><!---->// Attempt to use the whenDefined promises map by defining all of the elements:<!----></span><br>for(let i=0;i<1e5;++i) {<span class="line"><!---->for(let i=0;i&lt;1e5;++i) {<!----></span><br>  customElements.define('x-foo-' + i, class extends HTMLElement {});<span class="line"><!---->  customElements.define('x-foo-' + i, class extends HTMLElement {});<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Drop files here to add them (Max: 10.0 MB per comment)
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <span class="line"><!---->This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition"><!---->http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<!----></a><br>CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<span class="line"><!---->CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder& builder,<span class="line"><!---->    CustomElementDefinitionBuilder&amp; builder,<!----></span><br>    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<span class="line"><!---->    const ElementDefinitionOptions* options,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br><br>  // 16: when-defined promise processing<span class="line"><!---->  // 16: when-defined promise processing<!----></span><br>  const auto& entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto&amp; entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<!----></span><br>  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<!----></span><br>    entry->value->Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<span class="line"><!---->    entry-&gt;value-&gt;Resolve();                // can run JS callback function<!----></span><br>    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<span class="line"><!---->    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<span class="line"><!---->During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<!----></span><br><br>We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<span class="line"><!---->We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined"><!---->https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; name,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<span class="line"><!---->  if (ThrowIfInvalidName(name, false, exception_state))<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise();<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise();<!----></span><br>  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<span class="line"><!---->  CustomElementDefinition* definition = DefinitionForName(name);<!----></span><br>  if (definition)<span class="line"><!---->  if (definition)<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state);<!----></span><br>  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<span class="line"><!---->  ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver = when_defined_promise_map_.at(name);<!----></span><br>  if (resolver)<span class="line"><!---->  if (resolver)<!----></span><br>    return resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->    return resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>  auto* new_resolver =<span class="line"><!---->  auto* new_resolver =<!----></span><br>      MakeGarbageCollected<ScriptPromiseResolver>(script_state);<span class="line"><!---->      MakeGarbageCollected&lt;ScriptPromiseResolver&gt;(script_state);<!----></span><br>  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<span class="line"><!---->  when_defined_promise_map_.insert(name, new_resolver);     // ***************** add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_`<!----></span><br>  return new_resolver->Promise();<span class="line"><!---->  return new_resolver-&gt;Promise();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<span class="line"><!---->This function can be called by JS function |customElements.whenDefined|<!----></span><br><br>This bug is similar to this issue <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to this issue <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108472<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<span class="line"><!---->Chromium 93.0.4542.2 (Developer Build)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

I tried with something like the below, but I'm unable to trigger a UAF in ASAN.<!----></span><br><br>The iterator erase already does a re-find (see [1]) which I think should make it safe.<span class="line"><!---->The iterator erase already does a re-find (see [1]) which I think should make it safe.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/wtf/hash_map.h;l=612;drc=4d354dd4d0fa1db2f924262a4abe67e2fda9d7b4<!----></a><br><br><br>My attempted cartoon repro:<span class="line"><!---->My attempted cartoon repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>// Set up whenDefined handler that adds more whenDefined handlers:<span class="line"><!---->// Set up whenDefined handler that adds more whenDefined handlers:<!----></span><br>customElements.whenDefined('x-foo').then(() => {<span class="line"><!---->customElements.whenDefined('x-foo').then(() =&gt; {<!----></span><br>  for(let i=0;i<1e5;++i) {<span class="line"><!---->  for(let i=0;i&lt;1e5;++i) {<!----></span><br>    customElements.whenDefined('x-foo-' + i).then(() => {console.log(`foo-${i} defined`);});<span class="line"><!---->    customElements.whenDefined('x-foo-' + i).then(() =&gt; {console.log(`foo-${i} defined`);});<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br>// Define the element:<span class="line"><!---->// Define the element:<!----></span><br>customElements.define('x-foo', class extends HTMLElement {});<span class="line"><!---->customElements.define('x-foo', class extends HTMLElement {});<!----></span><br><br>// Attempt to use the whenDefined promises map by defining all of the elements:<span class="line"><!---->// Attempt to use the whenDefined promises map by defining all of the elements:<!----></span><br>for(let i=0;i<1e5;++i) {<span class="line"><!---->for(let i=0;i&lt;1e5;++i) {<!----></span><br>  customElements.define('x-foo-' + i, class extends HTMLElement {});<span class="line"><!---->  customElements.define('x-foo-' + i, class extends HTMLElement {});<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <span class="line"><!---->This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition"><!---->http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<!----></a><br>CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<span class="line"><!---->CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp; entry = when_defined_promise_map_.find(name);<!----></span><br>  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (entry != when_defined_promise_map_.end()) {<!----></span><br>    entry->value->Resolve(); // iterator may now be invalid<span class="line"><!---->    when_defined_promise_map_.erase(entry); // iterator may now be invalid<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<span class="line"><!---->During the resolution of promise, we can trigger JS callback to add new elements to `when_defined_promise_map_`, causing the map's backing to be reallocated. This frees the buffer underlying |entry|, but |entry| is then deleted from the map.<!----></span><br><br>We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<span class="line"><!---->We can add more element to `when_defined_promise_map_` by triggering this function<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=291<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined"><!---->https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#dom-customelementsregistry-whendefined<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise CustomElementRegistry::whenDefined(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp;       <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <span class="line"><!---->This bug is in function |CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal| <!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/custom/custom_element_registry.cc;drc=e9aef1ba859e5942b9e8f5396380008b4443f69d;l=103<!----></a><br><br>// <span class="line"><!---->// <!----></span>http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition"><!---->http://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#dfn-element-definition<!----></a><br>CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<span class="line"><!---->CustomElementDefinition* CustomElementRegistry::DefineInternal(<!----></span><br>    ScriptState* script_state,<span class="line"><!---->    ScriptState* script_state,<!----></span><br>    const AtomicString& name,<span class="line"><!---->    const AtomicString&amp;           font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        dominicc: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress.         /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
